oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Purina - 1946-02-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Purina sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Jud Collins (announcer), Eddy Arnold (host/performer) with his Tennessee Plowboys, and performers Jack Guthrie, the Cackle Sisters, the Crook Brothers, Lonzo & Oscar (their initial Opry appearance), Rod Brasfield, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Jamup & Honey, and the Bailes Brothers. Claude Jarman Jr., star of the movie The Yearling, also appears on the show as a guest. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddy Arnold; Tennessee Plowboys; Jack Guthrie; Cackle Sisters; Crook Brothers; Lonzo & Oscar; Rod Brasfield
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening theme -- Jud Collins introduces Eddy Arnold -- Opening statement (Eddy Arnold) -- How Was I To Know (Eddy Arnold and his Tennessee Plowboys) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Jack Guthrie -- I'm A Branding My Darling With My Heart (Jack Guthrie) -- Eddy Arnold introduces the Cackle Sisters -- You Nearly Lose Your Mind (Cackle Sisters) -- Purina commercial (Eddy Arnold, Jud Collins) -- Eddy Arnold introduces the Crook Brothers -- John Henry (Crook Brothers) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Claude Jarman Jr. -- Eddy Arnold introduces Lonzo & Oscar -- Charming Betsy (Lonzo & Oscar) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Collins, Jud; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Tennessee Plowboys; Guthrie, Jack; Cackle Sisters (Musical group); DeZurik, Carolyn; DeZurik, Mary Jane; Crook Brothers; Jarman, Claude, 1934-; Lonzo and Oscar; Brasfield, Rod; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Jamup & Honey; Wilds, Lee Davis, 1902-1982; Bailes Brothers
